alert.note: Alert for Charles City (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 1:15AM EST until January 11 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of east central, south central, and southeast Virginia, including the following counties, in east central Virginia, Charles City and New Kent. In south central Virginia, Prince George. In southeast Virginia, Surry and Sussex. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 113 AM EST, VDOT reported standing water on roadways in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but little to no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Kent, Charles City, Waverly, Claremont, Disputanta, Burrowsville, Cabin Point, Garysville, Ruthville, Rustic, Adkins Store, Holdcroft, Providence Forge, Taylors Corner, Oak Hill Corner, Barham, Brandon, Savedge, New Hope and Spring Grove. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
